heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The storm today ranked 5th for the length of the storm when compared to others in our records and it lasted 22.4 hours.  7.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.1mm per hour.  The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.4°C) and outside temperature (down 4.9°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (up 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6553 lux), cloud levels (up 607 m), and rainfall (down 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
